content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can do it using the DataFrames package in Julia.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The values in this new column are the year and month of each DateTime in the original column `dt`, concatenated together into an integer format "yyyymm". 

Here is how you can use it:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[now() + Month(i) for i in 1:3])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
